channel.title: Update command (PI)
channel.description:
Everytime i do ::update command, it doesn't wait the amount of time i put in to kick everybody.
for example... ::update 60 , it will kick everyone around 42 seconds and say press any key too continue on my run cmd.
Where can i change this? Sorta new to p.i so i don't know too much.
Help appreciated! Thanks for your time :D

item.title: Update command (PI)
item.dc:creator: @s_3_3_m_3 s 3 3 m 3
item.description:
@s_3_3_m_3 wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("update")) { for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a; PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false; PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true; PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis(); c2.SaveGame(); c2.sendMessage("[SERVER FIXES] - Automaticly saved you're account!"); } } }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxpkpurexx xxpkpurexx
item.description:

can you post your code???

item.title: Update command (PI)
item.dc:creator: @K_R_3_W K R 3 W
item.description:
@K_R_3_W wrote:

Hello there I tested the ::update 60 on my server and it counted all the way down to 0, So i thought I would post my Update Command. Not sure if the command is the problem but its worth a shot.
Here it is:
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“update”)) {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
int a = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
PlayerHandler.updateSeconds = a;
PlayerHandler.updateAnnounced = false;
PlayerHandler.updateRunning = true;
PlayerHandler.updateStartTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
}

Read full topic
